WRITING.TEXT: We are currently using Uber/Lyft and the experience has been GREAT!

We went to MK today, busiest week of the year...got there when it opened at 8am and knocked out each of the popular rides without a fastpass before 11am! We were able to leisurely take on the rest of the day stress free.

If you've never used it before, you can use a promo code and get your first ride free... on both Uber and Lyft. They are the exact same, just different companies and they run the same. We've had great luck with both so far in Orlando this week. If anyone else in your party hasn't used them, they can, too. Depending on how many new users you have, it can cut your costs down significantly. I'm happy to give you a promo code if you message me, because it benefits the person who gives it to you, too. ;) OR...if you use a promo code, then share your own personalized promo code with others in your party, they will each get a free ride for creating an account and you will get credits for every person who uses yours.

Now that I think of it, if neither you or your girlfriend have ever used it, you can get four rides free (two from each company), plus if you share your code with her and she uses it, you'll get an additional two rides (one on each). It's a steal and much more comfortable and easy than a cab. No cash required.
Our trips from Hilton Orlando to any of the parks has been between $12-16 each way.

The crowds got pretty thick, but I don't believe they did any type of closures at MK. We took an afternoon nap offsite and were able to get back inside later. Crowds significantly died down after 9 p.m.
Unfortunately, the latest Uber we've gotten was at 11 pm, but there are so many circling the resorts, I wouldn't think that would be an issue. Nobody else seems to be using them and there are a ton.

Yeah! Definitely take advantage of being first time users. At Epcot and Hollywood Studios, Uber and Lyft can pick you up right at the front. At Magic Kingdom, have them drop and pick you up at Polynesian Resort, it's a 5 minute walk from MK and so much easier. We haven't been to Animal Kingdom yet so I don't have any pickup/drop off advice for that, but I assume since it's less popular that they can drop you off right at the front.

This tip is saving our lives this week! Thank you!! We've been able to knock out all the rides before 11 at each park, go home and nap, come back for dinner and casual strolling while scoring some last minute fast passes for good rides!

Thank you for this tip! At lunch this afternoon, we were able to get Frozen passes for 12:30! We're finishing lunch now and our FP+ will be ready by the time we arrive next door at Norway! Best advice ever.

WRITING.TITLE: Thanks for your advice! Top tips that helped us have a great first trip to WDW!
WRITING.TEXT: It was my first trip to WDW and my boyfriend hadn't been there since he was a kid. I did some major research, mostly here on this subreddit, and the valuable advice y'all gave me helped us have the best and most efficient trip! 1. Get up early and be at the park when it opens. We were able to knock off all the rides we wanted without even using any FP+. If the lines are short, save your FP+ and rebook them for something else you'd like to ride later in the afternoon. If you get all the rides you want done, use your FP+ and tip #2 below to score the best rides again. 2. Use the app aggressively. You have to use all three FP+ before you can book another top tier ride. Our trip was planned too last minute to get the best rides, but we were able to snag Frozen one afternoon immediately following a great last minute lunch reservation by refreshing the app (modify an existing pick by flipping back and forth through morning/afternoon or different times or deliberately use your last FP+ so you can use a fourth pass on any ride you want.) We also rode Soarin' a second time the same day by using this approach! 3. Take a nap break! We went super early and hit all the rides we wanted to... went back to our hotel around 11 a.m. and came back in the evening for dinner and a few more rides or a show. We still got everything we wanted done but avoided the busiest (and warmest) time of day. 4. If you're staying off property, use Uber or Lyft! We never waited more than 5 minutes for our ride. Didn't have a single bad experience and staying about 20 minutes off property, our ride never cost us more then $17 before tip...even during surge pricing. If we had rented a car, we would've had to pay $20 to park at each resort per day and another $20 for parking at our hotel per day -- on top of what the rental itself would cost. 5. Split meals. My boyfriend and I split every meal and never left hungry. Portions are HUGE and this cut down on expenses significantly. Thank you all for your great advice! We didn't wait in a single line longer than 15 minutes and everything seemed to work out in our favor...it was all due to research and having a plan, but also knowing how to be efficient. We wouldn't have had a clue if it hadn't been for all of you!
No, we were able to book top tiered rides no problem after using all our FP+. We rode Frozen in the afternoon, then were able to book Soarin' for 5p.m.
Everyone kept telling me that next week the parks will be "ghost towns" compared to how they were this week.

Welcome! I live downtown, too. You're going to love it. If you like lifting weights, check out CrossFit Hit amp; Run... it's downtown, located on the South Main side. They've got a free class for non-members every Saturday at 10 a.m. if you'd like to check it out without committing.

Download the free Walt Disney Experience app. You can link your tickets to it and make all your FP+ and dining reservations with it. You will never have to visit another Fastpass kiosk again, plus like I mentioned, if you aggressively refresh the Fastpass options, you'll score some hard-to-get reservations.
Yeah!! That was the best advice we received! Longest line was 15 minutes and that's because there were six of us trying to do a ride together.

Our costs were crazy low, even during surge pricing, and pick-up and drop-off at every park was easier than we even expected. Happy to answer any questions you have!

Hey there! My friends and I run a group called Memphis Supper Club, you can find it on Facebook. We are all transplants who have grown to love Memphis! Our next event will be a "brunch club" edition downtown on Jan. 29. I'm working out the details, but feel free to join the group. Memphis is obviously very different than Portland, in almost every way possible. Being from the northwest myself, I can honestly tell you that it doesn't have a ton of people who *love* the outdoors...there is a lot of litter, trash, etc... but Memphis does have great qualities and you will learn to love it for what it is... a town with incredible history, great music, and a lot of people who want to make it better.

Oh -- and as far as church goes... Christ City Church in Midtown is fabulous. The pastors are down to earth and their sermons are well explained and easy to relate to. Check them out... you'd think the pastors all came from PDX with their beards, hipster clothes, and all that. ;-)
This is amazing!! Great work! It's always inspiring to see someone's hard work pay off!

Vacations aren't nearly as much fun when you know you'll be paying it off for the next year or five...because you're doing it this way, you'll be able to enjoy yourself and not worry about the financial side of things with a cloud hanging over your head. It'll all be worth it!!! Keep going!!!

For an entire month every year when they close Riverside for MIM, it completely disrupts downtown living by forcing traffic and trucks along Front St instead. We have a spike in crime, hit-and-run crashes, and trucks thinking they can fit under the railroad bridge. I'm not a fan.
http://www.wmcactionnews5.com/story/31809331/festival-season-in-downtown-memphis-creates-traffic-headaches-accidents
And I've personally seen at least THREE trucks get stuck under the railroad bridge on Front Street just before Nettleton. It blocks the entire street until they can get themselves unstuck.

If you're not looking to make reservations, you might check in with each campground's host when you arrive. They can tell you when people are expected to leave so you can grab a site on the first come, first served basis. Otherwise, check out recreation.gov to reserve campsites at the places you're interested in.

We went for a day and a half and, as adults, that was plenty of time. The trick is getting there as soon as it opens (or an hour earlier than that if you're staying on property) so you can knock out all the rides without standing in crazy lines. We were successful with this strategy at Christmastime. The Harry Potter rides should be done first since you can't use fast passes for those, but if you go extra early, you won't need fast passes for any of them! And they don't tell you about it, but fast passes are available for after 4pm for less money. We got the park hopper, but I think you could do one park on one day and do the second park on the next day as long as you make use of the early hour benefits!!

Rafter drowns on north fork of the flathead river -- be careful out there!
WRITING.TEXT: Greetings from the desk of Sheriff Chuck Curry, For Immediate Release On Friday, July 14, at about 6 pm. The Flathead County Sheriff #8217;s Office received a report of a drowning on the north fork of the Flathead River. The victim had been rafting with friends when their raft flipped on a hazardous section of the river just north of Glacier Rim known as the #8220;shelf #8221;. All three of the occupants of the raft were thrown into the water. The raft got stuck in the hydraulic below the shelf. The victim helped the two other occupants to shore. The raft became dislodged and he attempted to swim after it to retrieve it but drowned in the process. None of the occupants of the raft were wearing a life jacket. An initial search of the river Saturday evening by North Valley Search and Rescue, Sheriff #8217;s Office personnel and the Two Bear Helicopter was unsuccessful in locating the victim. On Saturday, members of the Flathead County Sheriff Dive Rescue team and North Valley Search and Rescue resumed the search. Divers were successful in locating the victim in about 15 feet of water in an eddy below the shelf. The victim is identified as Lee Alan Gebro, 44 years of age, from Minneapolis Minnesota.

Hey! I'm currently going on Week 11 with WAG and I've noticed major changes. I had loosely counted my macros in the past, and saw some results, but was rarely consistent and had a hard time holding myself accountable. I think the program is worth it if you need that accountability factor. They give you the macros you should be hitting and they adjust them as you go... I started out with 145 protein, 240 carbs, 65 fat, and 25 fiber... They start you off at rather high numbers to see how your body reacts and adjusts, then drop them as they see fit. I'm now at 145p, 180c/160c on rest days, 50f, and 25 fiber. When I was weighing in at the beginning, my weight fluctuated between 168 and 171, and yesterday I weighed in at 161 and it fluctuates up to 164, so I'm definitely losing weight... and because they require front/side/back photos each week during your check-in, you can see the changes... I absolutely have results. Plus, my coach doesn't scold me or make me feel bad, just suggests ways I could do better or different modifications I can make... Your meals rely 100% on what your macros are and I've been able to get into a groove that has changed my relationship with food completely. I used to be a snacker and whenever I was bored at work, I'd go to the vending area to find something to snack on. Now, I still snack, but I'm totally OK eating a container of apple sauce or yogurt and no longer feel the urge to snack when I'm not hungry. I've been able to identify the boredom/hungry feeling and actually move past it. Today for example, I ate 2 eggs and 2 pieces of toast for breakfast, a chicken pizza I made myself for lunch, apple sauce, yogurt, all the black coffee I want, a diet coke, post-workout protein shake, and I'm planning to have an apple chicken sausage on a bun for dinner, with a dessert of gummy bears and pistachios to round out the numbers I have left, which is usually carbs/fats for me. There is also a private Facebook group for Team WAG members that has been super helpful and encouraging. It's a very active group of people posting their pictures to inspire others, their CrossFit wins, no matter how small, recipes, ideas about how they plan for vacations, etc. Bottom line... I love it! When you sign up, you have to commit to at least 3 months... but now that i'm passing that point, I'm absolutely going to stick with it. I was hesitant at first because of the price, but it's working for me, so I'll make it work in the budget. =)

WRITING.TITLE: Northern Lights Saloon extended its season!
WRITING.TEXT: Northern Lights Saloon extended its season to September 17! My family always goes to Glacier the second week in September and we usually miss the saloon by just a day or two... but this year, they will be open the entire week we're there! I've been going to the park since I was a little kid and I've never set foot inside! lt;3

Whenever we go in September, it's already thinned out quite a bit. I would guess that Labor Day weekend is the last major weekend for the park... things are hit-or-miss about whether they're open after that. We love going in September! But, don't go TOO late in September because the lodges, shops, etc, will eventually start closing.
With all of that being said, I highly recommend the second week in September. We literally get Bowman Lake damn near to ourselves each year.

I'm not worried about it all. I'm incredibly sad to hear about Sperry Chalet, but I've been to the park countless times during wildfires. This wildfire is burning a very small area when you think about how huge the entire park is, so the east side won't be affected, which is where a lot of tourists go. Going-to-the-Sun Road remains open and all the activities like horseback riding, red bus tours, etc, are still going... even around Lake McDonald Lodge despite that lodge closing early. It truly shouldn't affect you much unless you were planning on staying at Lake McDonald Lodge.

Absolutely. Sorry, I'm just seeing this message. I just responded to you on another thread. We're camping at Two Medicine Campground, Bowman Lake, etc... the park is seriously massive and there are two distinct sides separated by the Continental Divide... the Sprague Fire won't affect the east side at all... and it hasn't impacted much other than Lake McDonald Lodge (and Sperry Chalet, of course) and that's because employees live there and they didn't want them breathing smoke for another couple of weeks. For people who are just visiting, coming and going, it shouldn't be an issue.

Ha! Nice. We're coming from Tennessee. Hey, neighbor! There are a ton of other campgrounds since St. Mary is only hard-side camping right now. Google Bowman Lake...during the week we're going, you'll have no problem getting a campsite and the view is absolutely absurd it's so gorgeous. It's my favorite place in the whole park. I can give you several other camping recommendations if you'd like, but that's my #1!
Another thought... if you decide it's too smoky for you (I honestly am not worried about it at all), Yellowstone isn't far and Banff is reasonable distance, too.
Butter, chives, and a seasoning called Nikki's Hot Ass Seasoning. #128514; That's it!
Well damn.
Sounds like people in the park on this thread are saying the conditions might even be affecting the east side by next week. #128563;

I'm reading some headlines and I'm thinking now that if you're driving, you might feel it was more worth the trip at another park this time around. They're evacuating portions of the park and I have a feeling Going-to-the-Sun will close before too long. #128531;

I'll be there next week, too. Saturday-Thursday. We're starting at Two Med and we've rented a forest service cabin near the north fork of the Flathead... so that should be interesting. I expect it to be pretty smoky, but the park is huge so we'll just readjust the plan if needed. We're also planning some time at Bowman. Just hoping I can get a scoop of Huckleberry ice cream in Apgar before fires get too close!

I'm right there with you! Will be in the park the exact same dates as you. I think you have the right attitude and we'll just need to be flexible and open to the fact that our vacations aren't the priority, you know? There will still be plenty to do and plenty of park to explore... I just hope that other structures in the park are spared and everyone stays safe. After what happened in the Great Smoky Mountains last year, its scary how fast conditions and the fires can change. Just be safe and be flexible. The park is massive and gorgeous...you'll have a good time no matter what! Plenty to do and see!

Thanks for the update. I've been hearing that Two Med amp; Many Glacier is hit or miss... how much you can see just depends on the day. National Weather Service is predicting a slight chance of rain on Friday... let's hope that comes through. I'm so worried about Lake McDonald Lodge, I can't even stand it.
Mom is too tired to even deal.

You'll probably have to take Highway 2 to St. Mary and the east side of the park. You're not going to be able to drive by Lake McDonald. You can stop in Apgar if you'd like to see the lake...it's got a beach and a great view. Stop at Eddy's for huckleberry ice cream while you're there. I'd imagine that the campsite hosts might frown upon you sleeping in your car in the campground's parking lot. But, I'm not sure. It wouldn't hurt to just roll up to the site host and ask... I would assume that it's probably comparable to someone parking their RV in the parking lot instead of renting a site. Of course, the folks who do the backcountry camping have to park their cars somewhere. I'm sure you can find someone to ask in the park when you get there. I'll be in Glacier next week, too. I'm glad you're not letting the fires ruin your trip, but I do hope you'll come back to see it in all of its glory another time, too! The views are incredible and I don't want you to be disappointed because they won't be as spectacular this time around. I've heard the east side is smokier some days and clearer on other days... Many Glacier, I've also heard, is one of the clearer places you could check out. As of right now, I don't think the Highline is closed...I've been scouring the headlines and I haven't read that.

WRITING.TITLE: Workflow help needed... I have a Surface 3, iPad, and iPhone... please help if you can!
WRITING.TEXT: I just bought a GoPro Silver 4. I used it last weekend and recorded about 12 pretty short clips so I can get used to it and figure out best practices for easy editing, etc, before a trip I have next week. I'm running into several problems getting the footage off of my GoPro and available to edit anywhere. 1. iPhone apparently doesn't have enough space no matter how much I delete to download a single clip, even a short one. 2. iPad has the same problem even though I have no other photos/videos on it. 3. Surface doesn't have enough space. So, I put the files on an external hard-drive. 4. When they're on an external hard-drive, I can't edit them with any type of real editing software because my Surface can't handle it. 5. I decided to try GoPro Plus so I might be able to edit them on my iPhone or iPad by accessing them in the cloud... but I can't seem to get any of my videos uploaded to the GoPro Plus cloud. I keep receiving error messages when I try to upload them manually via Desktop. When I tried to upload them via Quik App last night, it took several hours and it appeared to be complete, but the clips still haven't shown up in the cloud. I was on the phone with GoPro Support last night and she told me it would work if I tried uploading to Quik directly from my camera. It didn't. I don't have another couple of hours to wait on GoPro Support only to have them tell me something stupid. So, I'm here begging for help. I've invested way too much time in just trying to figure out how to go about making even simple edits using the computer, phone, and tablets I have... and we're not even talking about long clips right now. I'm about to go on a trip where I'll be filming long hikes and drives! I'd love to know I'm actually going to be able to do something with this footage when I get home. Please help.

Yes, I did try the web uploader first. It fails for the "larger" files and it appears to work for the smaller ones, but then they disappear and never show up in the cloud. Even my "larger" files really aren't as big as you'd expect from GoPro footage.

iPhone: 28gb iPad: 12gb Getting a new computer probably isn't an option right now... Good to know about GoPro Plus. I knew the auto-upload from camera only worked for the Hero5, but I thought I'd still be able to manually transfer videos. Sounds like I'll probably just have to invest in some other cloud storage in order to edit with Pinncale or something on my iPad or iPhone unless I want to edit one clip for a quick share moment.
Thank you! I'll look into that!

My colleague and I were booked on a Delta flight later this afternoon. Yesterday, we called our employer #8217;s call center to change to an earlier flight. She gave her information and was switched to the earlier flight, then I did mine with the same call center agent. This morning, I had a seat assignment, but she was listed as #8220;standby. #8221; I know very well that standby in Atlanta is bad news. I went on the app to look at the seat map and there were 7 open seats and I was even allowed to change mine. In fact, it allowed me to change my seat all the way up until we boarded! My colleague was never able to pick a seat and she kept getting the notification that her seat would be assigned at the gate. Gate agents at our originating airport kept reassuring her that she #8217;d get a seat and this was normal... they were right. She did get a seat. But why didn #8217;t she get a seat when I got one yesterday? She was booked on the flight before me. Thanks for any clarity you can provide! Edit: I #8217;ve read other threads about this, but it still doesn #8217;t make sense. She is not a Medallion member, but I haven #8217;t reached Medallion status yet either, though I am closer than she is.
We booked using the same call center and the same agent through our employer. They never book us on basic economy.

WRITING.TEXT: Me too! I actually loved CrimeCon. Some people commented on this thread that it was exploitative and insensitive to families of victims... and I didn't feel that way whatsoever. I thought everyone who spoke was there to speak on behalf of victims and none of it was exploitative. I didn't visit Podcast Row, but I do get that feeling from podcasts every once in a while... that they are making fun of situations and don't always have a lot of tact, so I can see how if they had an experience with a podcaster, that might make them see the whole conference in that light. The Dateline crew being there was the #1 reason I went... it was great meeting them and I loved their panel. I enjoyed hearing about the challenges of their jobs, as well as how they keep in touch with the families they cover and how those families are now helping other families and it's a big community. I wish I had more time to speak to each of them during the meet amp; greet. I was at the end of the line and I felt like by the time I got there, Josh, Dennis, and Andrea were so tired of seeing everyone fawn over how much they love Keith Morrison. They seemed drained and I can't blame them. I only had enough time to get out one thought -- and it ended up being directed at Keith... but his response made my whole day! I was also surprised by how much I enjoyed Nancy Grace's presentation! I was only in there to get a better seat for the Dateline panel coming up next. I had never watched Nancy Grace, never cared to because I only heard negative things about her from other people, but I was really touched by how passionate and emotional she is about everything that has gotten her to this point. I didn't know her story and I appreciate that she takes every single case she ever tried personally and that's what drives her to keep holding people accountable and advocating for those victims. Overall, the experience was absolutely amazing... I'm planning to go to New Orleans next year... just wish it wasn't in JUNE! Damn it's going to be hot.

You don #8217;t need a permit to camp in campgrounds, only backcountry. Most campgrounds are first come, first served... so you #8217;ll want to get there early on the day you #8217;d like to camp if possible. The good news is... there are a ton of campgrounds and some off the beaten path, so you #8217;ll find something eventually! I #8217;m sure others can weigh in on your best bets and strategy if you can #8217;t get there early... my family goes in September and January so we have no problem finding spots. My favorite is Bowman Campground (best views out of all in the park, IMO), but more challenging to get to...which sometimes means it #8217;s less crowded! Second favorite is Two Medicine Campground... it #8217;s one of the most popular, but also has quite a few campsites. Enjoy your first trip! It #8217;s an incredible place.

They should be paying you time and a half for those hours over 40. Let #8217;s be serious. It #8217;s called OVERTIME. Or.... you should take a long lunch or leave 30 minutes early. Your boss is actually breaking the law by not paying you the hours they #8217;re asking you to work.
As much as I support bring your dog to work days, seems like there are probably rules about that in a hospital.

Also... if you can #8217;t find anything inside the park on your first day, stay at one of the campgrounds just outside and then try again early the next day. We stayed at a campground on the outskirts of the park (Devil Creek Campground) in September when there was a voluntary evacuation due to wildfire and it ended up being a great space despite being near the highway... you couldn #8217;t hear any traffic and there were a lot of recent bear sightings! It also had the nicest porta potties I #8217;ve ever seen! They took great care of the place. So, I #8217;d recommend it if you encounter a lot of full campgrounds inside the park.
Have fun in Fargo, ND! ;-) (I grew up an hour north of there) For real though, you #8217;ll love Glacier and every trail you take will be breathtaking! Enjoy!

To be completely honest, there isn #8217;t a lot to see between the two places. You #8217;ll find that eastern Montana and all of North Dakota is pretty boring when it comes to driving. If you do feel like stopping along the way, stop at Theodore Roosevelt National Park and explore the Badlands. Just make it a mini park tour! We used to go to Medora on field trips in school.... #128514; #128514; in case you #8217;re tired of camping by then!
Not the asshole. Everybody has their limits.

My favorite place. Had a grizzly bear encounter camping there when I was a kid! I #8217;ll never forget it. Coolest story I #8217;ve got.

I was probably 11-12 years old, I #8217;d guess. The day before, my dad caught me putting on deodorant and freaked out. I insisted it was unscented, but he said it didn #8217;t matter and animals could smell it. I didn #8217;t listen and continued on with my day thinking he was overreacting. That night, my cousin and I slept in the tent with my dad and my brother slept in his usual spot in the van. Around 6 a.m. or so, my dad unzipped the tent to go to the bathroom and a grizzly bear walked right in front of the tent. He describes it as the side of the bear being within five inches of his face as it brushed by our tent. My dad zipped up the tent and woke us up, told us to be quiet and still because there was a bear in our campsite. We could hear the bear walking circles around our tent. Then it began digging into the dirt next to our tent, from inside it sounded like it was right next to our tent, but it was actually a few feet away when we looked later. Because of the deodorant incident the day before, I was 100% convinced the bear smelled my #8220;unscented #8221; deodorant and was trying to find me. We cowered in the tent for about 10 minutes as the bear hung around our campsite. Eventually he left our site and walked down the road of Bowman Campground. At that point, we all ran into the van. I specifically remember jumping on my brother and him being so pissed at me for waking him up until we told him the story. Later that morning, campers began walking around camp, talking about the bear, and finding places where it had scratched at trees and gotten into stuff that people had left out (obviously they got in trouble for that). We recounted our story for the rangers and learned it wasn #8217;t the first sighting they #8217;d had that in camp that summer. It was an incredible experience and I #8217;ll never forget it. To hear my dad tell the story is the best... he even uses sound effects to bring it to life for people.
They would probably exploit your fear of flying and make sure you make it to the end simply for the fact that you #8217;d be forced to face your fears every single damn day.

Just got an email that due to an #8220;unforeseen supply disruption, #8221; my bike won #8217;t be delivered today. No estimate on when I #8217;ll get it. Kinda angry, not gonna lie. =(

WRITING.TITLE: Bike delivery canceled... #8220;unforeseen supply disruption? #8221;
WRITING.TEXT: I #8217;m super sad! This is what I #8217;ve been looking forward to all week... It was supposed to arrive between 9 a.m. and noon. They refunded my delivery fee, but didn #8217;t give me anymore information about what #8220;unforeseen supply disruption #8221; means or when my bike will be delivered now. Waiting on the call from XPO... Anyone else ever have this happen? UPDATE: I called XPO and the woman who answered tried to call the warehouse but it had already closed, so she couldn #8217;t provide me any information. Next, I called the sales rep who helped us buy the bike. She was super nice and apologetic, and said there certainly isn #8217;t a supply issue. She sent me the number to Peloton support and said they will be able to reach out to everyone involved to help facilitate the new delivery. She asked me to keep her posted so she can help speed things up in any way she can. I called Peloton support, and the guy was great. He told me he #8217;s going to reach out to the warehouse for me tomorrow, and he also plans on reaching out to XPO and filing a complaint with management if it turns out to be something that went wrong on their end. Overall, I #8217;m disappointed, but I #8217;m very impressed by the level of customer service Peloton has shown so far and that goes a very long way with me. ADDITIONAL UPDATE: It took an entire week for XPO to get back to me. They finally called on Monday, Aug. 13 to tell me that they only deliver to my city on Tuesdays, but unfortunately they were full on Tuesday, Aug. 14, so I wouldn't be receiving my bike for another full week, Aug. 21. I find it absolutely ridiculous that I called a week prior, when they probably could have fit in our delivery -- only to finally have my call returned 6 days later when they're schedule is too full. Of course, I'll be out of town for work on Aug. 21 and won't return until Monday, Aug. 28, so hopefully my boyfriend will be able to take the day off to wait for our shipment.
The email said they will be calling me when they have the reschedule details. If I don #8217;t hear from them by noon, I #8217;ll give them a call.

I #8217;m going to be VERY unhappy if it takes a month... why are they even scheduling delivery dates if they #8217;re short on supply? I feel like Peloton should manage people #8217;s expectations on the frontend when they are buying the bike! Ughhhh... sorry to hear that you had to wait so long. Glad you love the bike though!
For sure. Good idea.

Yeah, don #8217;t worry... I #8217;m going to make some calls. What I don #8217;t understand is why they didn #8217;t tell me this yesterday when I called to get the delivery window... surely they knew then that they didn #8217;t have my bike.
Yeah, I #8217;ve seen a lot of the comments both on Reddit and Facebook about them not having live classes recently. I wonder what #8217;s up with that!

I just updated the original post with a little info about what happened when I followed up today... I should know more tomorrow when the Peloton support team gets in touch with the warehouse. I #8217;ll keep you posted! I #8217;m happy that their level of customer support seems to be really high.

Inconvenience I #8217;m sure. They didn #8217;t tell us it wasn #8217;t coming until we were already in our delivery window, at home waiting for it... despite calling the night before to check in. They had every opportunity to tell us they weren #8217;t coming.
Ughhh!!! I still don #8217;t have a delivery date either. My patience is running thin. #9785; #65039;
We ordered it through a sales rep at a store over the phone.
No updates at all. I #8217;m on vacation now so I #8217;ve quit reaching out. Will see if they get this sorted by the time I get home.
Absolutely love that island!!!!
There was a whole presentation at CrimeCon by podcaster Bob Ruff that laid out the timeline of events. Very eerie and a lot of holes in the case.

I find it absolutely ridiculous that I called a week prior, when they probably could have fit in our delivery -- only to finally have my call returned 6 days later when they're schedule is too full. Of course, I'll be out of town for work on Aug. 21 and won't return until Monday, Aug. 28, so hopefully my boyfriend will be able to take the day off to wait for our shipment.

WRITING.TITLE: Ordered July 30 -- still no bike.
WRITING.TEXT: Update to this post that has fallen down the subreddit because it's been several weeks: [https://www.reddit.com/r/pelotoncycle/comments/95c483/bike\_delivery\_canceled\_unforeseen\_supply/](https://www.reddit.com/r/pelotoncycle/comments/95c483/bike_delivery_canceled_unforeseen_supply/) For those of you who have recently ordered -- I do hope you get your bikes on your scheduled delivery dates... but want you to be aware of some issues I've been having because I certainly wasn't prepared for the amount of frustration and disappointment I've experienced in waiting for my delivery. I wish someone had given me some information about supply issues upfront to manage my expectations and prevent us from taking time off of work to wait for a delivery that was never going to happen. \----- My scheduled bike delivery on Aug. 7 was "canceled due to an unforeseen supply disruption." It's been three weeks since I ordered it and... still no bike. Hopefully it'll be delivered tomorrow. Of course, I'm out of town for work all week so even if it does arrive, I'll have to wait another week to try it out. Our sales rep said they are experiencing an "unforeseen delay in deliveries countrywide." So I'm a little surprised to hear that people who ordered after I did have already received their bikes. I'm extremely disappointed in the Customer Service department... they started out responsive and I initially felt like they cared, but they never actually reached out to close the loop with me about our delivery date or act as a liaison between me and XPO. They did send me a survey, in which I responded that I still have no bike so I'm not prepared to rate my experience until my ticket is closed. Speaking of XPO... They didn't get back to me for an entire week after I called to find out why my bike was never delivered on Tuesday, Aug. 7. When they did finally return my call, it was the following Monday, Aug. 13 and they said they only deliver to my city on Tuesdays, but they were too booked to delivery our bike the next day (Tuesday, Aug. 14). So our delivery date is, instead, Tuesday, Aug. 21 and I'll be out of town. For the second time, my boyfriend will have to take the day off of work to wait on our delivery. Never mind that he had already taken one day off of work three weeks ago only to get the delivery cancellation notice DURING our delivery window. I plan on sending a full explanation of our experience and disappointments to Peloton once it's all said and done. Waiving our delivery fee certainly doesn't make up for my boyfriend having to take two days off of work for this.
Considering I work for FedEx, I feel like they could have shipped my bike that way and I would #8217;ve been happy to assemble it myself.
They did refund the full shipping price, so that was good... but the cost of missing a full day of work exceeds $250.

WRITING.TITLE: UPDATE: Peloton finally arrived... totally worth the wait. Had the best ride today with Ally Love!
WRITING.TEXT: It took a month, but our Peloton finally arrived! It was well worth the wait... took my 5th ride this afternoon, this time with Ally Love. Her perspective, positivity and energy is everything! #8220;For those of you who have been to hell and back, and we can still see that ash on your forehead, I want to say, #8216;Welcome home. Welcome home. #8217; #8221; #8220;You know how fortunate you are to sweat right now? Wow. #8221; She #8217;s absolutely right. #128522;
